fields.description:
h2.Reproduce the problem
1. Create new user, set home page
2. _Move_ users home page (and children) to another space
3. the user has no default home page
4. Create a page called +Home+ for the user
5. click on user in Dashboard>People
6. links to  Dashboard  > People  > User  > Browse Space  > List Pages - Tree View and *not*   Dashboard  > People  > User  > Home  although +Home+ exists for that user (accessed through the Dashboard  > People  > User  > Browse Space)

h2.Workaround:

We found that inside the DB the PageID for the users HomePage table entry is NULL.
Setting the PageId to the PageId of the new Home page fixes the problem and   Dashboard  > People  > User  > Home
fields.summary: Cannot set a page as default home page for user

fields.description:
Multiple user entries can be created in Space Permissions for "Individual User Permissions" section, by entering the username manually instead of choosing from the "User Picker".

To reproduce:

1) Go to "Browse Space->Space Admin->Permissions
2) Edit permissions
3) Manually type a username of a user who already exists in the list (please *do not* use the User-Picker in this step)
4) Save All

Notice that this username now has multiple entries in the Individual Permissions list.

Workaround: Remove duplicate entries and always use the "User Picker" to add new users to the permissions list.
fields.summary: Multiple entries for same username in space permisisons

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a group called "Test" through Administration->Manage Groups
2) Go to Browse Space->Space Admin->Permissions
3) Edit Group Permissions
4) Manually type "test" in the "Grant Permission to" section (Please *do not* use the Group Picker in this step) and add this group to space permissions
5) Save All

The group that is added to space permissions is "test" instead of the expected "Test" group name. Hence all users belonging to "Test" group, when try to access this space get a "Not Permitted" error as "Test" and "test" are now considered as two different groups.

Workaround: Removing the {{faulty}} group name and then using the "Group Picker" for selecting the group instead, will resolve the problem.
fields.summary: Manually typing, does not respect case-insensitivity among group names for space permissions

fields.description:
Tomcat version 5.5.x LINUX/UNIX do not have the file ./bin/setenv.sh any more.
When running out of memory users find help on page [Manage Application Server Settings | http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Managing+Application+Server+Memory+Settings] which suggests that 
{code}JAVA_OPTS="-Xms128m -Xmx256m"{code} (no dots, though) should be used. I suggest to mention in the doc that the setenv.sh file should be created in the _TOMCAT_HOME_/bin directory
fields.summary: Documentation for Out of Memory needs updating for JAVA_OPTS in setenv.sh

This comes from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-14035

It is not possible to discover if a space has anonymous view via the Remote API using getPermissionsForUser(), regardless of whether you authenticate as a real user or not.

This stops us from integrating Confluence with our SSO solution, CAS.

fields.description:
After the implementation of the CAS client for Confluence (http://www.soulwing.org/confluence-cas.jsp) and some web.xml configuration (attached), all users will be prompted an "Insufficient Permission" page first after user login every time (more details and screenshot are attached for reference). Someone suggests that some actions can potentially be done on seraph/confluence to rectify the issue. To followup, I'd like to seek your advice :
1. Would it be possible that the insufficient permission problem be resolved relatively easily by making configuration adjustment or minor application enhancement on Confluence/Seraph?
2. If this issue can not be easily or completely resolved, are there any suggestion or turnaround that we (all users of CAS and confluence) can do to either avoid (bypass) or reduce the impact of this problem (of getting this warning prompted everytime after login)?

A no. of discussions somewhat related to this issue which have been made in the past are linked for reference :
http://www.soulwing.org/jira/browse/SCC-10
http://www.soulwing.org/jira/browse/SCC-22
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257254993&#257254993
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7524
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2439

Thanks for your advice in advance.

Remark : the attached configuration and discussion is extracted from http://www.soulwing.org/jira/ discussion.
fields.summary: Insufficient Permission Message after implementing CAS SSO for Confluence

fields.description:
Confluence pages with images embedded often do not flow well because it is difficult to see how the image relates to the text and vice-versa. Use of LaTeX-style markup for image metadata will help improve readability of confluence pages which have images.

Two examples of useful image metadata are caption text and image identifiers. Caption text will help to put an image in context without reading the entire page. An image id can be used to reference the image from within the text (eg, see fig1) to improve maintainability of a page and also make it easy for readers to locate the image in question.
fields.summary: Metadata on images.

fields.description:
Currently, the pagination is performed upon the raw results returned in the searchBean, but only the items which pass the permissions checks and duplicate full name checks are displayed to the user. This is confusing, particularly if there is a large difference between the two results. 

I don't see why duplicate full names should ever be excluded, and the pagination should be performed on the pruned result set, not the raw results obtained. This bug was not introduced in 2.7, but still exists on trunk.

Actual ordering looks like:
Adam
Ziggy
bert
xena

But should look like:
Adam
bert
xena
Ziggy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10253].
  {panel}

Instead of just 'watching' a page yes/no, allow more flexibility in how a user interacts with a page:  I grouped these both together because they seem like similar 'cron'-based page notification events.

- set a reminder
-- click 'remind me', enter a date and time. An email notification is sent at that date and time with a URL to that particular content. Reminder has nothing to do with the watch status. 
-- (optionally, allow other email addresses to be submitted, in a 'trusted' environment')

- snooze an actively changing page
-- after responding to a page change notification, click 'snooze'. set a date and time. All 'change notifications' for that page (for that user) will be postponed until after that snooze date. On the snooze date, the user will either get a single notification with a complete change long for that content, or nothing if nothing has changed. After the snooze period, the watch status returns to normal. 
-- (optionally, allow ALL notifications to be surpressed. this would be used to spare co-authors from an email barage if you know you are going to make dozens of edits in the next few hours.)
fields.summary: Set 'Page Reminders' and 'page snooze'

fields.description:
When a user edits a page without changing its content, their edit does not show up in the version history.  This is usually a feature.  However, if the user has made a change to the page's restrictions and commented on why the do it, the edit should be shown in the version history.

To reproduce:

# Go to an edit page screen.
# Edit the page restrictions, eg click "Choose Me".
# Add a comment describing the change
# Save the page.

If you look at the version history there is no record of the restriction being made.
fields.summary: The page edit comment is lost when page restrictions are changed without changing the page content.

fields.description:
When using the {{Information Macros}} in a theme(such as the "Classic Theme"), it appears that the panel's width rendered are base on the content length instead of the standard page content width.

Please see screenshot for the result produced, (macros.jpg).
fields.summary: {note} {warning} {info} {tip} macros do not display a standard width when using Classic Theme

fields.description:
Some DBAs, especially in large companies, maintain a policy in which applications are not allowed to create database tables. This is often a strict policy. It's a somewhat common support request to ask how to do this. If we chose to keep this documentation specific, we'd have to provide the SQL for this operation for each version. Short of doing that, we could write a procedure like this:

# Install Confluence, connected to test instance of database. Hopefully the policy does not pertain to the test/dev instance of the db.
# Create a db on production by hand using the database from test as a model. This should include the insertion of data as well, at least for the admin user as well as any other data.
# Using the confluence-home directory from the test installation as a model, configure the connection URL string from confluence.cfg.xml to point to the manually created database on the production db.

Without doing this, the setup wizard will detect the existing database but still prompt the user to overwrite. if the operation is done successfully, there should be no setup wizard when Confluence is launched in the production environment.

One additional problem to keep in mind is that upgrading tasks may require table creation as well.
fields.summary: Add documentation for creating db tables manually

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10237].
  {panel}

I would like a global setting such that anonymous access can be disabled for all but nominated projects.

Heres the scenario:

We allow anonymous access, but only have introduction spaces available providing help to new users.

We have made the call to only allow access to corporate data to authenticated users.  I have configured all team spaces to not be available anonymously, however, occasionally people re-tick anonymous access.  Personal spaces are more problematic, as their creation is automatic, unlike team confluence spaces, I am not able to set their access.  A global checkbox removing this option (and being applicable to new spaces) would solve the problem.

To complicate matters, we would still need nominated spaces to be anonymously available, these would provide access to 'introduction' type spaces.

This would enforce business need to restrict access to information that is currently 'voluntary'.
fields.summary: Allow administrative configuration of 'policy' to disallow anonymous access to all but nominated spaces (stops space admins even enabling anonymous access)

fields.description:
By default when you install confluence standalone, the server xml has the below. 

{code:xml}
<Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector" port="80" minProcessors="5" maxProcessors="75" enableLookups="false" redirectPort="8444" acceptCount="10" debug="0" 
connectionTimeout="20000" useURIValidationHack="false" URIEncoding="UTF-8"/>
....
....
<!-- <Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75" enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true" acceptCount="100" 
scheme="https" secure="true" clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" keystorePass="rbswiki" keystoreFile="%JAVA_HOME%\bin" URIEncoding="UTF-8"/> -->
{code}

However, if a customer was to uncomment the connector for SSL, and setup their web.xml so that HTTP redirects to HTTPS (like the steps outline in [Adding SSL for Secure Logins|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+SSL+for+Secure+Logins+and+Page+Security|]), it would fail as HTTP would redirect to port 8444 rather than 8443. 

Either the redirect port needs to be changed to 8443 or the port of SSL connections needs to be changed to 8444.
fields.summary: For Standalone by default the redirect port on the http connector is incorrect

fields.description:
Let's say I'm preparing a page where I'm archiving a list of pages labeled by reports and months and years, but we are in october and I have no november label yet. Or, for any reason, a label is not defined yet, but requested in a page by the contentbylabel macro. Wouldn't it be more logical to return nothing if no page has ALL of the labels instead of ignoring undefined labels and returning the result of reports+2007 because november is not found? It seems to me that it's the purpose of a logical operator AND to return false if an assertion fails.

contentbylabel:reports,2007,november|operator=AND
fields.summary: operator AND should consider an undefined label as false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10226].
  {panel}

I have created a page family (Example with childen Child1, Child2, and Child3) and a template ExampleTemplate which would deliver a page with similar layout as the Example page. However, I found no documentation on how to create a page family using templates so that child pages will be created automatically. So my questions are: 
1. Is it possible to create a template with associated children pages so that when the main page is created using that template, the children pages will be automatically created or can be edited if a child page is also a templete?

2. If the above is not available, is there a way to COPY (not MOVE - it wouldn't be a page family template if the children are gone) the child pages from Example (or selecting from some or all the pages in a Space) to the page being created using the template, i.e., see PageCreatedByExampleTemplate? To keep the child pages unique, this process would need either to automatically prepend a predefined string (i.e., PCBET_ in my example) to the new child pages or have the ability to enter it (either each one individually or one prefix for all) at the time of creation.

Example
Child1
Child2
Child3

ExampleTemplate

PageCreatedByExampleTemplate
PCBET_Child1
PCBET_Child2
PCBET_Child3
fields.summary: Page Family Template

fields.description:
The Apache XML-RPC server included with Confluence uses the MinML sax parser by default to parse incoming RPC requests. This parser uses the platform default character encoding to decode the incoming XML instead of standard XML procedures for determining document encoding. This can cause string corruption when the platform encoding is not compatible with the encoding and characters used in the XML-RPC call.

Apache XML-RPC server allows any JAXP standard parser to be used to parse incoming requests; we should configure it to use Xerces which is already included with Confluence and obeys the rules regarding XML document encoding.
fields.summary: XML RPC server uses platform default character encoding to decode requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10208].
  {panel}

In the global theme configuration screen, the "Default Theme" means the standard state-of-the-art look and feel that Confluence ships with.  I'll refer to that as the "Standard Theme" in this description.
In the space theme configuration screen, the "Default Theme" is correctly described as "the globally configured look and feel."  Unfortunately, if the global theme is not configured to the Standard Theme, then a space cannot be configured to use that theme.

To replicate:

1) Set the global theme to 'Confluence Classic Theme'
2) Set the space theme to 'Confluence Classic Theme'. This configuration works.
3) Switch the space theme to 'Default Theme'. The space appears similar to the Classic Theme.
fields.summary: Allow spaces to use the "Default" theme, even if it is not globally configured as the default theme

org.apache.commons.logging.LogConfigurationException: org.apache.commons.logging.LogConfigurationException: Class org.apache.commo
ns.logging.impl.Jdk14Logger does not implement Log

Occurs in Confluence 2.6.2 .war installation on Websphere (and possibly other environments). This has been reported by a customer, but not yet replicated by Atlassian.

Solution was to replace commons-logging-1.0.jar with commons-logging-1.0.4.jar (which comes with confluence 2.6.0).
fields.summary: "org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Jdk14Logger does not implement Log" on Websphere due to commons-logging-1.0.jar
Need a way to categorize mail

fields.description:
I often use smileys to indicate status for tasks that I list in tables (green check mark for completed tasks, red - symbol for tasks that are yet to be completed, etc).

Since we updated to 2.6.0, every time I use a smiley in a table, Confluence appends a line break after the symbol. When I try to insert:
{code}(/) {code}
I get:
{code}(/)\\{code}

I can remove the line breaks manually, but they reappear automatically as soon as I save the page.

I've attached an example of the hard breaks.
fields.summary: Adding emotion (smiley characters) in tables automatically appends an undesirable line break

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10198].
  {panel}

I am having issues with Invites expiring after only 24 hrs. Could someone at Atlassian please explain what the Invite module functions actually do/mean so I can sort this. I've read the Invite plugin page (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Invite+Plugin) and it doesn't mention what these actually do. What is an "unnecessary" invite, what's the difference between "expire invitations" and "every night", and the difference between "remove unnecessary invitations" and "every Night remove unnecessary invitations"?
Does "expire invitations" mean monthly?
I'd like to have some control over expiring invitations and I don't want them to last only 24hrs and have people emailing me constantly about their expired invitation.
Which module do I have to Disable so Invites do not expiring at all?
fields.summary: Invite Expiry Module Documentation

We have export CATALINA_OPTS="-XX:PermSize=128m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m"

Please advise how else we can perform the migration.
